definition: to say/to tell/to announce/to report/to denounce/to file a lawsuit/to sue

sentences.english: I will apprise you of the situation .
Can you tell me who was the first president of the United States?
sentences.chinese: 您能告知我，我國第一免分統鳴什麼實字？

sentences.english: Please forward to everyone you know.
sentences.chinese: 敬請告知你認識的每個人。

sentences.english: Update plans for the balance year, and fine-tune plans in details for the coming quarter .
sentences.chinese: 告知剩餘年份的計劃及下一季的詳細計劃。

sentences.english: The club members were immediately apprised of his change of plans.
sentences.chinese: 俱樂部成員們即刻被告知了其計劃的變更。

sentences.english: When Jim died, one of his colleagues telephoned with the news.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆的死訊是他的同事打電話告知的。

sentences.english: He was told that a council officer had reason to believe he was "dripping his cigarette" while driving his car.
sentences.chinese: 他被告知政府有理由相信他在開車期間“亂彈菸蒂”。

sentences.english: And please advise the price of this fabric by adding the WICKING finishing.
sentences.chinese: 請告知此布價是已經包含了作吸溼排幹功能的價格。

sentences.english: If any debt becomes overdue, inform the branch head immediately.
sentences.chinese: 如遇應收賬款逾期未到帳，立即告知知分公司總經理。

sentences.english: Submit the plan book to SD 15days before the activity starts.
sentences.chinese: 告知社團着手設計活動策劃書。

sentences.english: Tell the man behind the counter what you want.
sentences.chinese: 你要什麼就告知櫃檯後面的男服務員。

sentences.english: Don't stress yourself out with news and "staying informed" too much.
sentences.chinese: 不要太強調新聞時訊和“被告知”。

sentences.english: They had been told only one month but drag the half-year cycle drawback.
sentences.chinese: 當初被告知只需一個月的退稅週期卻拖了近半年。

sentences.english: If you think it acceptible, please inform me of the detailed address.
sentences.chinese: 如可以的話，請告知詳細的通訊地址。

sentences.english: Tributary states must do as they are told.
sentences.chinese: 因爲他們被告知這是附庸國必須要做的。

sentences.english: The Burrow, we are told, is on the other side of the village from the hill.
sentences.chinese: 我們被告知，陋居在村莊的另一邊，山的對面。

definition: variant of 答覆|答复[da2 fu4]
to remind/to call attention to/to warn of
connection/contact/relation/to get in touch with/to integrate/to link/to touch
to learn of (an event)/to hear about (sth)
to find out/to know/to learn about
to know the facts/to understand/to be familiar with the situation
